title: Chassis ECM Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering

body.body: Chassis ECM Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering
Disconnection of the Chassis ECM Connectors
Never pull directly on the wires when disconnecting an electrical connector.
If you pull on the wires, the connector or the wires can become damaged.
Notice - General - Never disconnect ECM with ignition ON
Never disconnect an ECM when the ignition switch is in the ON position.
Disconnecting an ECM with the ignition set to ON can cause multiple fault codes to be logged in the ECM memory.
Always disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first, before you disconnect an ECM.
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.
Chassis ECM Disconnect and Connect CM8; CR8; CS8; PB1; PJ1; PJZ; PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
Slide the safety lock out of the connector locking device.
Press down on the locking device and gently pull back on the connectors to release them from the chassis ECM.
Reconnecting of the Chassis ECM Connectors
Three different connectors are used in the chassis ECM, making sure a correct connection is always made.
Damage to the connector pins may result if an attempt to fit the connectors incorrectly is made.
If the lever is not fully over to the rear position, it is possible that the connector may not fully engage into its socket.
Fit the connectors into their sockets and continue pushing until the locking device clicks.
Push the safety lock until it locates into the locking device and an audible click can be heard.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; PJZ; CS8; CR8; CM8; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1; PJ1; PB1

body.body: Chassis ECM Connectors pin numbering CM8; CR8; CS8; PB1; PJ1; PJZ; PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
The illustration below shows the pin numbering system used in the Pinpoint Tests - Chassis ECM.
Connector 1 is grey in colour and has 16 pins.
Connector 2 is black in colour and has 20 pins.
Connector 3 is light grey in colour and has 16 pins.
As viewed on the mating face with the ECM (as per the illustration), pins are numbered from right to left with number one in the top right corner.

Chassis ECM Connector Pin Numbering
The illustration below shows the pin numbering system used in the Pinpoint Tests - Chassis ECM.
Connector 1 is grey in colour and has 16 pins.
Connector 2 is black in colour and has 20 pins.
Connector 3 is light grey in colour and has 16 pins.
As viewed on the mating face with the ECM (as per the illustration), pins are numbered from right to left with number one in the top right corner.
